name: Aero Predator

skill.description: Summon an Aero Predator that throws a dart forward. The dart will bounce between enemies up to three times, dealing 28.80% Aero DMG each time it hits.

description:
This enemy has higher RES to Aero DMG.
A humanoid TD holding hunting gear, gathering storm as boomerangs.
Aero Predators' thrusting of boomerangs is as unpredictable as vortex morphing around the seas. Taking the wastelands as its hunting ground, it takes delight in pursuit and prey.

name: Chirpuff

skill.description: Summon a Chirpuff that self-inflates and blasts a powerful gust of wind forward 3 times. Each blast inflicts 38.40% Aero DMG and pushes enemies backwards.

description:
This enemy has higher RES to Aero DMG.
Widely distributed riparian fish-like animals with a special algal flower structure on the crown of their skull and capable of drifting in the wind.
When threatened, Chirpuff will rapidly puff air and make a warning chirp.

name: Cruisewing

skill.description: Summon a Cruisewing that restores HP for all current team characters by 1.80% of their Max HPs plus an additional 80 points of HP, up to 4 times.

description:
This enemy has higher RES to Spectro DMG.
Mayfly-like animals with a light body. They have wings like those of butterflies. Good at circling their enemies with flexible moves.

name: Diamondclaw

skill.description: Transform into Crystal Scorpion and enter a Parry State. Counterattack when the Parry State is over, dealing 48.00%+96 Physical DMG.

description: Scorpion-like animals found mostly in dim areas. Their thick, hard crystal claws are deadly weapons against enemies.

name: Electro Predator

skill.description: Summon an Electro Predator to shoot the enemy 5 times. The first 4 shots deals 17.28% Electro DMG, and the last deals 46.08% Electro DMG.

description:
This enemy has a higher RES to Electro DMG.
A humanoid TD holding hunting gear, using lightning as arrows.
Electro Predators' pulling of strings is as fast as thunders striking in the first springs. Taking the wastelands as its hunting ground, it takes delight in pursuit and prey.

name: Excarat

skill.description: Transform into an Excarat and tunnel underground to advance. In this state, you have the ability to change your direction and are immune to damage.

description:
This enemy has higher RES to Havoc DMG.
Mole-like animals with excellent burrowing capabilities. They are able to excavate even concrete and steel.
With their complicated underground passage system, Excarats can easily hide their traces and confuse their enemies.

name: Fission Junrock

skill.description: Summon a Fission Junrock. Generate a Resonance Effect that restores 2% HP for friendly units each time. If not in combat, you can pick up minerals or plants nearby.

description:
A TD constructed with fragmented rocks. Commonly found in the company of Vanguard Junrock.
Different from the latter, Fission Junrock has a more active and unstable energy and easily explodes under impacts. Records show that it is sometimes used as a throwing weapon by other Tacet Discords.

name: Fusion Dreadmane

skill.description: Summon a Fusion Dreadmane that fiercely strikes the enemy, dealing 32.00%+64 Fusion DMG.

description:
This enemy has higher RES to Fusion DMG.
Wolf-like animals that roam the dry areas, known for their fury and bloodlust.
In order to fight against more powerful enemies, Annihilation Dreadmanes usually hunt in packs. Their operations are marked by the art of carnage.

name: Fusion Prism

skill.description: Summon a Fusion Prism to fire a crystal shard, dealing 32.00%+64 Fusion DMG.

description:
This enemy has higher RES to Fusion DMG.
A mineral TD commonly found in mine veins. Under its rock body, blazing magma is contained.
Although its combat capability is relatively feeble, when it is destroyed, the energy it releases enhances the Tacet Discords in its vicinity.

name: Fusion Warrior

skill.description: Transform into Fusion Warrior to perform a Counterattack. If the Counterattack is successful, the cooldown time of this skill will be reduced by 70%, and 288.00% Fusion DMG will be dealt.

description:
This enemy has higher RES to Fusion DMG.
A humanoid TD with blades grown from its arms. Yearning for powerful opponents, it burns with a fighting spirit as surging as the blades at the end of its limbs.

name: Glacio Predator

skill.description: Summon a Glacio Predator that throws an ice spear, dealing 46.08% Glacio DMG on hit. Deal 4.61% Glacio DMG up to 10 times during the charging time, and 23.04% Glacio DMG when the spear explodes.

description:
This enemy has a higher RES to Glacio DMG.
A humanoid TD holding hunting gear, shaping frost as spears.
Glacio Predators' throwing of spears is as accurate as snowflakes piercing through the air. Taking the wastelands as its hunting ground, it takes delight in pursuit and prey.

name: Glacio Prism

skill.description: Summon a Glacio Prism that continuously fires three crystal shards, each dealing 38.40% Glacio DMG.

description:
This enemy has a higher RES to Glacio DMG.
A humanoid TD holding hunting gear, shaping frost as spears.
Glacio Predators' throwing of spears is as accurate as snowflakes piercing through the air. Taking the wastelands as its hunting ground, it takes delight in pursuit and prey.

name: Gulpuff

skill.description: Summon a Gulpuff that blows bubbles 5 times, each time dealing 23.04% Glacio DMG.

description:
This has higher RES to Glacio DMG.
Fish-like animals widely distributed in water bodies. Gulpuff often hides its body under the water surface and displays the lotus leaf-like structure over its head as a camouflage.
When threatened, these creatures swallow a large amount of water before inflating themselves and letting out gulp sounds to frighten the enemy.

name: Havoc Prism

skill.description: Summon a Havoc Prism to fire five crystal shards, each dealing 23.04% Havoc DMG.

description:
This enemy has higher RES to Havoc DMG.
A mineral TD commonly found in mine veins. Its rock body is haunted with black and profound powers.
Although its combat capability is relatively feeble, when it is destroyed, the energy it releases enhances the Tacet Discords in its vicinity.

name: Havoc Warrior

skill.description: Transform into Havoc Warrior to attack up to 3 times, dealing 171.73% Havoc DMG each time.

description:
This enemy has higher RES to Havoc DMG.
A humanoid TD with scythes grown from its arms. It favors opponents less powerful, for only the weak are at the mercy of its trials and sentences.

name: Hoartoise

skill.description: Transform into Hoartoise and slowly restore HP. Use the Echo skill again to exit the transformation state.

description:
This enemy has higher RES to Glacio DMG.
Tortoise-like amphibious creatures mostly often found along riverbanks. The shells on their backs are embedded with pieces of frost crystals. These creatures favor cold environments for naps.
A warmer surrounding will wake up a Hoartoise, as well as kindle its hot-tempered nature.

name: Hooscamp

skill.description: Transform into Hooscamp Flinger and pounce at the enemies, dealing 48.00%+96 Aero DMG.

description:
This enemy has higher RES to Aero DMG.
Gibbon-like lifeforms primarily gathered in deep woodlands, Hoochiefs have the tendency to show off their supremacy by stealing human belongings.
They are TDs within Huanglong borders found to manifest relatively sophisticated cognitive abilities, capable of emulating humans in the use of certain rudimentary weapons and tools. In this case flinging rocks.

name: Sabyr Boar

skill.description: Summon a Sabyr Boar to headbutt the enemy into the air, dealing 32.00%+64 Physical DMG.

description:
Boar-like animals commonly found in forests, with a sensitive and irritable nature.
Sharp tusks are the solution to every problem a Sabyr Boar encounters – it will always charge towards anything that intrudes its territory unrelentingly.
A Huanglong idiom also compares "Sabyr Boar's charge" to reckless people.

name: Snip Snap

skill.description: Summon a Snip Snap that throws fireballs at the enemy, dealing 32.00%+64 Fusion DMG on-hit.

description:
This enemy has higher RES to Fusion DMG.
An immature humanoid TD that exudes small amounts of magma, as though they are on the verge of boiling point.
When they battle, the magma on their body erupts with sparks and emits a crackling sound similar to "snip-snaping".

name: Spectro Prism

skill.description: Summon a Spectro Prism to emit a laser that hits the enemy up to 8 times, dealing 14.40% Spectro DMG each time.

description:
This enemy has higher RES to Spectro DMG.
A mineral TD commonly found in mine veins. Its rock body emits a blinding, brilliant glow.
Although its combat capability is relatively feeble, when it is destroyed, the energy it releases enhances the Tacet Discords in its vicinity.

name: Tick Tack

skill.description: Summon a Tick Tack that charges and bites the enemy. The charge from Tick Tack will deal 68.48% Havoc DMG to the enemy, and the bite will deal 102.72% Havoc DMG to the enemy. Reduces enemy Vibration Strength by up to 5.00% during 5s.

description:
This enemy has higher RES to Havoc DMG.
An immature humanoid TD. Maybe imitating the clacking of teeth of human laughter, they always make sounds of "tick tack" whenever they encounter humans.

name: Traffic Illuminator

skill.description: Summon a Traffic Illuminator, immobilizing enemies for up to 1s. The immobilization will be lifted once the enemy is hit.

description:
Fractsidus' faithful cultists.
Lacking in Forte yet bearing a strong yearning for power, they crossed forbidden scientific boundaries. Through the use of special mechanical components, their human bodies are amalgamated with TD limbs, thus their bodies mutate into powerful guns.
However, TD frequencies distort the cultists' mentality and corrode their bodies. They choose to bandage themselves to conceal their twisted face.

name: Vanguard Junrock

skill.description: Summon a Vanguard Junrock that charges forward, dealing 32.00%+64 Physical DMG to enemies in its path.

description:
A TD constructed with fragmented rocks. It has poor eyesight and a preference for rampaging.
The clinks and clacks of its rock skin colliding with other objects help Vanguard Junrock identify its circumstances.

name: Whiff Whaff

skill.description: Summon a Whiff Whaff that triggers an air explosion, dealing 51.36% Aero DMG and produce a Low-pressure Zone. The Low-pressure Zone continuously pulls enemies nearby towards the center for 2s, dealing 19.97% Aero DMG up to 6 times.

description:
This enemy has higher RES to Aero DMG.
An immature humanoid TD, hovering in the air with the help of winds. It is able to alter its movement speed through the simple absorption of gases.
When it exhales air backwards and accelerates, it often emits a sound akin to "whoosh".

name: Baby Viridblaze Saurian

skill.description: Transform into Baby Viridblaze Saurian to rest in place, and slowly restore HP.

description:
This enemy has higher RES to Fusion DMG.
Large amphibian-like creatures mostly found in forests. Their hard skins are found to emit heat.
Research has found that the tenacity of Viridblaze Saurian's skin has a positive correlation to the beast's body temperature.

name: Young Roseshroom

skill.description: Summon a Baby Roseshroom that fires a laser, dealing 32.00%+64 Havoc DMG.

description:
This enemy has higher RES to Havoc DMG.
Roseshrooms are fungus-like TDs inhabiting wetlands, whose caps are like the petals of a rose when fully bloomed, hence the name.
While they are stationary, the core on their caps can gather and release light rays to attack passing creatures.

name: Zig Zag

skill.description: Summon a Zig Zag that denotates Spectro energy, dealing 48.00%+96 Spectro DMG and creating a Stagnation Zone that lasts 1.8s.

description:
This enemy has higher RES to Spectro DMG.
An immature humanoid TD that often emits a "zig zag" sound when they focus and release light rays.

name: Autopuppet Scout

skill.description: Transform into Autopuppet Scout, dealing 272.00% Glacio DMG to the surroundings, and generate up to 3 Ice Walls to block off the enemies.

description:
This enemy has higher RES to Glacio DMG.
The TD is a parasite of the Sentry Vehicle, camouflaging itself with a rusted and damaged armor shell. It serves as a "sentinel", monitoring all movements within the city and removing any potential threats.

name: Carapace

skill.description: Transform into Carapace to perform a spinning attack that deals 112.00% Aero DMG, followed by a slash that deals 168.00% Aero DMG.

description:
This enemy has higher RES to Aero DMG.
A TD living in discarded vehicles. It camouflages itself among ruins and foliage. Once disturbed, they exhibit a terrifying posture.

name: Chasm Guardian

skill.description: Transform into Chasm Guardian to perform a Leap Strike that deals 273.60% Havoc DMG on hit. Current character loses 10.00% HP after the hit lands. Periodically restore current character's HP after 5s for up to 10.00% of their Max HP.

description:
This enemy has higher RES to Havoc DMG.
A tall TD guardian. Its figure resembles a huge boulder from the abyssal depths.
Despite its appearance of an indestructible fortification, the nature of Chasm Guardian is never to protect, but to crush any obstacle that blocks its advance.

name: Cyan-Feathered Heron

skill.description: Transform into Cyan-Feathered Heron and charge at the enemies, dealing 236.80% Aero DMG; This Echo Skill interrupts enemy Special Skills upon dealing damage.

description:
This enemy has higher RES to Aero DMG.
Heron-like animals found active in mountain forests and water edges. Though born with wide-spreading cyan wings, they only extend them and fly in roaring winds.

name: Flautist

skill.description: Transform into Flautist, continuously emitting Electro lasers, dealing 53.28% Electro DMG for a total of 10 times. Gain 1 Concerto Energy every time a hit lands.

description:
This enemy has higher RES to Electro DMG.
A Humanoid TD that casts its power by playing the instrument. Imitating the human behavior of playing flutes to transmit messages, the melody it produces is only noisy and hoarse.

name: Viridblaze Saurian

skill.description: Summon a Viridblaze Saurian to continuously spit fire, dealing 17.12% Fusion DMG 10 times.

description:
This enemy has higher RES to Fusion DMG.
Large amphibian-like creatures mostly found in forests. Their hard skins are found to emit heat.
Research has found that the tenacity of Viridblaze Saurian's skin has a positive correlation to the beast's body temperature.

name: Havoc Dreadmane

skill.description: Transform into Havoc Dreadmane to perform tail strikes up to 2 times. Each strike deals 116.64% Havoc DMG. An additional strike will be performed on hit, dealing 77.76% Havoc DMG.

description:
This enemy has higher RES to Havoc DMG.
Wolf-like animals that roam the plains, known for their opportunistic nature.
In order to fight against more powerful enemies, Havoc Dreadmanes usually hunt in packs. Their operations are marked by the art of ambush.

name: Hoochief

skill.description: Transform into Hoochief Cyclone and smack the enemies, dealing 268.20% Aero DMG.

description:
This enemy has higher RES to Aero DMG.
Gibbon-like lifeforms primarily gathered in deep woodlands, Hoochiefs have the tendency to show off their supremacy by stealing human belongings.
Unlike other Hoochiefs, Hoochief Cyclones can conjure air currents to not only launch long-range attacks but also restrict the movement of its targets.

name: Rocksteady Guardian

skill.description:
Transform into Rocksteady Guardian and enter a Parry State. Upon being attacked, deal Spectro DMG equal to 8.29% of the current character's Max HP, and perform a follow-up attack that deals Spectro DMG equal to 8.29% of the current character's Max HP.

Use the Echo skill again to exit the transformation.

If the attack received is a Special Skill attack, interrupt the enemy's Special Skill, gain a Shield equal to 30% Max HP, and perform a two-stage follow-up attack, each inflicting Spectro DMG equal to 5.52% of the current character's max HP. These follow-up attacks simultaneously launch three ground-breaking waves, each inflicting Spectro DMG equal to 4.59% of the current character's Max HP.

description:
This enemy has higher RES to Spectro DMG.
A tall TD guardian. Its figure resembles monolithic rocks from the mountains.
Despite its appearance of an indestructible fortification, the nature of Rocksteady Guardian is never to protect, but to crush any obstacle that blocks its advance.

name: Roseshroom

skill.description: Summon a Roseshroom that fires a laser, dealing 57.07% Havoc DMG up to 3 times.

description:
This enemy has higher RES to Havoc DMG.
Roseshrooms are fungus-like creatures inhabiting wetlands, whose caps are like the petals of a rose when fully bloomed, hence the name.
While they are stationary, the core on their caps can gather and release light rays to attacked passing by creatures.

name: Spearback

skill.description: Summon a Spearback to perform 5 consecutive attacks. The first 4 attacks deal 29.96% Physical DMG, and the last deals 51.36% Physical DMG.

description: Ferocious black bear-like animals. Their head and shoulders are covered with arrow-shaped clusters of sharp Tacetite, like indestructible thorns.

name: Stonewall Bracer

skill.description: Transform into Stonewall Bracer and charge forward, dealing 112.64% Physical DMG on-hit, then smash to deal 168.96% Physical DMG, and gain a shield of 10.00% of current character's Max HP that lasts 7s. Use the Echo skill again to exit the transformation state.

description: A TD constructed from rocks. Slow and clumsy, it possesses horrendous arm strength and prefers throwing stones to attack its enemies.

name: Tambourinist

skill.description: Summon a Tambourinist that periodically emits Melodies of Annihilation. Friendly units hit with Melodies of Annihilation deal an extra 14.40% Havoc DMG with their attacks, up to 10 times.

description:
This enemy has higher RES to Havoc DMG.
Humanoid TD that casts its power by playing the instrument. Imitating the human behaviour of playing bells and saying prayers, the words it emits are never blessing, but curses.

name: Violet-Feathered Heron

skill.description: Transform into Violet-Feathered Heron and enter a Parry Stance. Counterattack when the Parry stance is over, dealing 288.00% Electro DMG. If attacked during Parry Stance, you can counterattack in advance and additionally recover 5 Concerto Energy.

description:
This enemy has higher RES to Electro DMG.
Heron-like animals found active in mountain forests and water edges. Though born with wide-spreading purple wings, they only extend them and fly in furious thunderstorms.

name: Crownless

skill.description:
Transform into Crownless and perform up to 4 consecutive attacks. The first 2 attacks deal 134.08% Havoc DMG each, the 3rd attack deals 100.56% Havoc DMG 2 times, and the 4th attack deals 67.04% Havoc DMG 3 times.

After the transformation, increase current character's Havoc DMG by 12.00% and Resonance Skill DMG by 12.00% for 15s.

description:
This enemy has higher RES to Havoc DMG.
Crownless is a Whisperin Tacet Discord born outside Gorges of Spirits along with the eruption of the strange Tacet Field. A vast mixture of human frequencies is detected within its physical form. For instance, the exhilaration and thirst for victory, the fear and resentment for casualty... Humans' long-suppressed barbarism is reified in Crownless and antagonized against themselves.
This creature is a pawn dispatched by the enemy in disguise, as well as a harbinger of the scourge of war.

name: Feilian Beringal

skill.description:
Transform into Feilian Beringal to perform a powerful kick. If the kick lands on an enemy, immediately perform a follow-up strike. The kick deals 231.84% Aero DMG, and the follow-up strike deals 283.36% Aero DMG.

After the follow-up strike hits, the current character's Aero DMG increases by 12.00%, and the Heavy Attack DMG increases by 12.00% for 15s

description:
This enemy has higher RES to Aero DMG.
A giant ape-like monster that resides at the towering Central Banyan, guarding the apes' territory from intrusion.
To avoid unexpected confrontation with it, the Midnight Rangers and the Huaxu Academy once collaborated in a special operation to fix the Feilian Beringal with a tracking bracelet, enabling the tracking of its movements within the forest.

name: Impermanence Heron

skill.description:
Transform into Impermanence Heron to fly up and smack down, dealing 310.56% Havoc DMG.

Long press to stay as Impermanence Heron and continuously spit flames, each attack dealing 55.73% Havoc DMG.

Once the initial attack lands on any enemy, the current character regains 10 Resonance Energy. If the current character uses their Outro Skill within the next 15s, the next character's damage dealt will be boosted by 12% for 15s.

description:
This enemy has higher RES to Havoc DMG.
A giant avian creature that flies around Desorock Highland. Its three heads are respectively responsible for ingestion, offense, and guard.
"Foolish left, wicked right. Center head's the greatest blight", so would Jinzhou rhymes describe the heads.

name: Inferno Rider

skill.description:
Transform into Inferno Rider to launch up to 3 consecutive slashes in a row, each slash dealing 242.40%, 282.80%, and 282.80% Fusion DMG respectively.

After the final hit, increase the current character's Fusion DMG by 12.00% and Basic Attack DMG by 12.00% for 15s.

Long press the Echo Skill to transform into Inferno Rider and enter the Riding Mode. When exiting the Riding Mode, deal 282.80% Fusion DMG to enemies in front.

description:
This enemy has higher RES to Fusion DMG.
A fiery "biker" born in the Port City of Guixu. It sets forth trials of courage with its unyielding flame for those who dare to trespass.
Throughout the long years, the truth of history gradually burns to ashes, and the knight who once sang boldly toward death becomes a harbinger of fear in the word of mouth among humanity.
"That is the rider who turns fear into fuel and brings calamity."
However, amidst the idle talk of the indigenous people in the Port City of Guixu, another version quietly spreads.
"When you face that mighty rider, set aside your fear and respond with your utmost reverence. Prove to him your courage to be the last one standing."

name: Lampylumen Myriad

skill.description:
Transform into Lampylumen Myriad. Perform up to 3 consecutive attacks.

Unleash a freezing shock by performing consecutive forward strikes, with the initial two strikes inflicting 200.16% and 200.16% Glacio DMG respectively, and the final strike dealing 266.88% Glacio DMG. Enemies will be frozen on hit.

Each shock increases the current character's Glacio DMG by 4.00% and Resonance Skill DMG dealt by 4.00% for 15s, stacking up to 3 times

description:
This enemy has higher RES to Glacio DMG.
An ensnarer that slumbers in a freezing mine pit, obsessed with collecting and imitating sounds. It can imitate human speech through a vibrating hum.
Lampylumen Myriad uses sound as bait to lure its prey, which will be frozen in the deep cold. The loss of warmth and the illusion before dying will cause human beings to pour out their last words, which contain great emotional fluctuations.
For Lampylumen Myriad, this is the frequency of the supreme taste.

name: Mech Abomination

skill.description:
Strike the enemies in front, dealing 48.64% Electro DMG. Summon Mech Waste to attack enemies. Mech Waste deals 320.00% Electro DMG on-hit and explode after a while to deal 160.00% Electro DMG.

After casting this Echo Skill, increase current character's ATK by 12.00% for 15s.
Damage dealt by Mech Waste is considered Outro Skill DMG.

description:
This enemy has higher RES to Electro DMG.
Created in the CSC labs, this Mechanical TD has evolved by consuming machine wrecks. Upon discovering traces of human frequencies, it became fixated on achieving perfection and grew larger as it improved its composition. A haunting symbol of humanity's relentless pursuit of scientific advancement, its presence serves as a subtle reminder of our obsession and descent into madness.

name: Mourning Aix

skill.description:
Transform into Mourning Aix and perform 2 consecutive claw attacks, each attack dealing 157.44% and 236.16% Spectro DMG respectively.

After the transformation, increase current character's Spectro DMG by 12.00% and Resonance Liberation DMG by 12.00% for 15s

description:
This enemy has higher RES to Spectro DMG.
A bird-of-prey-like animal that perches at the Whining Aix's Mire, with cries like a mournful song.
Legend has it that this bird once had a partner and that their chorus was a beautiful sound. Their names were not passed down, but their hymns were recorded and preserved by human beings.
Until one of them was deceased. The surviving one cried all day long, and the cries were so dismal it was called the Mourning Aix.
In the loss of a lover, the bird became oppressive and violent, allowing no one to step into its nest of lost love. It only lingers in the heavens while singing the eulogy, in pursuit of an illusion that is no longer there among the clouds.

name: Tempest Mephis

skill.description:
Transform into Tempest Mephis to perform tail swing attacks followed by a claw attack. The lightning strike summoned by the tail swing deals 102.48% Electro DMG each time, while the claw attack deals 175.68% Electro DMG.

After the claw hit, increase the current character's Electro DMG by 12.00% and Heavy Attack DMG by 12.00% for 15s.

description:
This enemy has higher RES to Electro DMG.
A powerful TD that roams the Central Plains. With the aid of thunderstorms, it keeps devouring human sounds of protection. Regarded as a vanguard of the Crownless.

name: Thundering Mephis

skill.description:
Transform into Thundering Mephis, engaging in a rapid assault of up to 6 strikes. The first 5 strikes deal 132.61% Electro DMG each, while the final strike inflicts 189.44% Electro DMG, with an additional 31.57% Electro DMG from the thunder.

After the final hit, increase the current character's Electro DMG by 12.00% and Resonance Liberation DMG by 12.00% for 15s.

description:
This enemy has higher RES to Electro DMG.
A powerful TD based in Desorock Highland with the power of thunder. It is considered one of the vanguards in the Threnodian's army.

name: Bell-Borne Geochelone

skill.description:
Activate the protection of Bell-Borne Geochelone. Deal Glacio DMG based on 145.92% of the current character's DEF to nearby enemies, and obtain a Bell-Borne Shield that lasts for 15s

The Bell-Borne Shield provides 50.00% DMG Reduction and 10.00% DMG Boost for the current team members, and disappears after the current character is hit for 3 times.

description:
This enemy has higher RES to Glacio DMG.
A torpid snapping turtle in the frozen lake, carrying an ancient bell on its back.
Some researchers once tried to transcribe the inscriptions on the bell, but accidentally disturbed the gargantuan Chelonian's dreams.
When it awakens, lasting toll will be echoing around the Gorges of Spirits.

name: Dreamless

skill.description:
Transform into Dreamless and perform 6 consecutive attacks. The first 5 attacks deal 54.08% Havoc DMG each, and the last attack deal 270.40% Havoc DMG.
For 5s after Rover-Havoc casts Resonance Liberation, the DMG of this Echo Skill is increased by 50%.

description:
This enemy has higher RES to Havoc DMG.
Along with the eerie Void Plenilune, this Whisperin TD appeared at the end of the Norfall Barrens.
Its very presence is an ominous reminder of the devastating war that once ravaged this land. Born from the residual energies of battle, it continues to evolve and has become the most feared weapon in the Threnodian's arsenal. With merciless destruction, it reawakens humanity's primal fear of warfare. And now, it greets its ruler, ready to unleash chaos upon the world.

name: Clang Bang

skill.description: Summon a Clang Bang that follows the enemy and eventually self-combusts, dealing 32.00%+64 Glacio DMG.

description:
This enemy has higher RES to Glacio DMG.
An immature humanoid TD. Small amounts of ice crystals are left on its body. It uses them to imitate the crisp sound of "clang bang" of ice colliding.

name: Dwarf Cassowary

skill.description: Summon a Dwarf Cassowary that tracks and attacks the enemy, dealing 38.40% Physical DMG 3 time(s).

description:
An endemic ratite-mimic TD inhabiting Mt. Firmament. Being flightless and non-hardy, it can only survive in areas below the mountain ridge.
Its name has two etymological origins within the Huanglong language family. One stems from a description from the Hongzhen Chronicle: "This ratite-mmic TD is plump and seemingly lack of intelligence."
The other is originated from the local dialect. Locals use the word to describe creatures that "look dumb".

name: Lava Larva

skill.description: Summon a Lava Larva that continuously attacks enemies, dealing 38.40% Fusion DMG with each hit. The Lava Larva disappears when the summoner is switched out or moves too far away.

description:
This emeny has higher RES to Fusion DMG.
A larvae-mimic TD mainly inhabits areas beneath the tundra, near geothermal heat sources.
By absorbing geothermal energy, it can produce lava through a special organ to melt the frozen soil and dig tunnels extending in all directions.
Lava Larva traces often lead to locations rich in geothermal energy.

name: Glacio Dreadmane

skill.description: Lacerate enemies as a Glacio Dreadmane, dealing 214.40% Glacio DMG on each hit. Equipped with 2 charges and can be cast mid-air. Glacio Dreadmane deals 20.00% more DMG while in mid-air and generates 6 Icicles upon landing, each dealing 32.00% Glacio DMG.

description:
This enemy has higher RES to Glacio DMG.
A wolf-mimic TD rampant in the snowland, gifted in stealth.
Glacio Dreadmanes utilize teamwork and mimicry as weapons against powerful opponents.

name: Lightcrusher

skill.description:
Lunge forward as a Lightcrusher, dealing 135.36% Spectro DMG. Generate 6 Ablucence on hit. Each Ablucence explosion deals 15.04% Spectro DMG.
Hold the Echo Skill to stay in the Lightcrusher form, which allows you to leap up and pounce forward in the air for a short distance.

description:
This enemy has higher RES to Spectro DMG.
An enormous feline-mimic TD, only sighted in Mt. Firmament in Huanglong.
According to the Hongzhen Chronicle, it is a solitary TD with four claws and a scaly back. It is called "Lightcrusher" because of the glowing tracks left in its wake.

name: Lumiscale Construct

skill.description: Transform into a Lumiscale Construct and enter a Parry Stance. If you are not attacked during the Parry Stance, slash to deal 553.60% Glacio DMG when the stance finishes. If attacked, counterattack instantly, dealing 553.60%+276.80% Glacio DMG. When hit with a Special Skill attack while in the Parry Stance, break the Special Skill and counterattack, dealing 553.60%+276.80% Glacio DMG.

description:
The enemy has higher RES to Glacio DMG.
Lumiscale Constructs are composed of Jué's defensive modules, commonly known as "Loong's Scales."
They are found throughout the Court of Savantae ruins in Mt. Firmament, tasked with eliminating intruders and potential threats to Jué.

name: Jue

skill.description:
Summon Jué to the aid. Jué soars through the air, dealing 48.64% Spectro DMG, and summons thunderbolts that strike nearby enemies up to 5 times, each hit dealing 19.46% Spectro DMG. Jué then spirals downward, attacking surrounding enemies twice, each hit dealing 48.64% Spectro DMG.
Casting this Echo Skill grants the Resonator a Blessing of Time effect that lasts 15s, during when:
  • The Resonator gains 16.00% Resonance Skill DMG Bonus
    • .
  • When the Resonator's Resonance Skill hits the target, inflict 16.00% Spectro DMG 1 time per second for 15s, considered as the Resonator's Resonance Skill DMG.

description:
This enemy has higher RES to Spectro DMG and higher RES to Electro DMG.
One of the Sentinels of Huanglong, taking the shape of a Loong. The guiding force behind Jinzhou's civilization.
A majestic "deity" with unquestionable power, omniscient of Jinzhou's past, present, and future. Jué, the wielder of time's flow, sees eons as mere moments. In an instant, Jué can change the universe forever.
"Seasons shift by decree, and all beings abide by their laws. Such is the nature of the universe."
